page.title: 10The 'Old Days' in Grangetown
page.content: Mr. Tough, an eighty one year old Grangetown inhabitant, told us that when he was a boy{Grangetown}had six {farms}and most of the farms kept cows. The milk cart came round Grangetown twice a day with fresh milk from the{farms}and you could buy as little as a quarter of a pint. He said many people kept hens in their back yards and they let them roam the streets. Mr.Tough's father had come from Four Stones near{Hexham,}over a hundred years ago,to work as a paper maker at the{Paper Mill}in{Sunderland and many families had come with him. He said he now spends most of his time working on an allotment and he goes bowling and dancing. He goes to St. Aidan's Church and has been in the choir there 70 years. He told us lots of other stories about the{'Old Days' in{Grangetown.
